keyword: how many calories in tuna salad
title: How Many Calories in Tuna Salad?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in tuna salad per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and tips for lighter versions in this nutrition guide.
h1: How Many Calories in Tuna Salad?
assumptions: Canned tuna in water (drained), mixed with regular mayonnaise, celery, onion, and salt; no added bread or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, tuna type, mayo brand, portion size, and ingredients; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of tuna salad has about 192 calories, with 16.5g protein and 12.5g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use light mayonnaise instead of regular
Add 50g chopped celery and reduce mayo

faqs.q: How many calories in tuna salad per serving?
faqs.a: About 192 kcal per 100g serving of basic tuna salad.

faqs.q: Is tuna salad high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 100g provides around 16.5g protein from the tuna.

faqs.q: How much fat is in tuna salad?
faqs.a: Typically 12.5g total fat per 100g, mostly from mayonnaise.

faqs.q: Can I make tuna salad lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, swap mayo for yogurt or light mayo to cut 30-45 kcal per 100g.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in tuna salad?
faqs.a: Around 450mg per 100g, varying by canned tuna and added salt.
